isis.stitle: INSTRUMENTS - 1000 SERIES - CLUSTER FAILURE DIAGNOSTICS - HARNESS CONTINUITY AND VOLTAGE TESTS

step1.para: Turn the key switch to OFF.
Unplug the wiring harness connector servicing the gauge in question from the cluster. Refer to CLUSTER HARNESS CONNECTORS and GROUP 08 - ELECTRICAL, Circuit Diagrams.
Using an ohmmeter, check the resistance of the sensor circuit affecting the gauge in question. The resistance should read less than one (1) ohm.
Using an ohmmeter, check the resistance of the harness ground circuit. The resistance should read less than one (1) ohm.
Turn the key switch to accessories position and using a voltmeter, check the harness power circuit. It should read just under battery voltage.
If all three harness circuits check OK, install a new cluster.
If the voltage measurement or either of the two electrical resistances is incorrect, a faulty sensor, connector, wiring harness or other failure is indicated and further testing is required.
